# awscc_logs_scheduled_query (Resource)

Creates a new Scheduled Query that allows you to define a Logs Insights query that will run on a schedule and configure actions to take with the query results.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `execution_role_arn` (String)
- `name` (String)
- `query_language` (String)
- `query_string` (String)
- `schedule_expression` (String)

### Optional

- `description` (String)
- `destination_configuration` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--destination_configuration))
- `log_group_identifiers` (List of String)
- `schedule_end_time` (Number)
- `schedule_start_time` (Number)
- `start_time_offset` (Number)
- `state` (String)
- `tags` (Attributes List) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--tags))
- `timezone` (String)

### Read-Only

- `creation_time` (Number)
- `id` (String) Uniquely identifies the resource.
- `last_execution_status` (String)
- `last_triggered_time` (Number)
- `last_updated_time` (Number)
- `scheduled_query_arn` (String)

<a id="nestedatt--destination_configuration"></a>
### Nested Schema for `destination_configuration`

Optional:

- `s3_configuration` (Attributes) (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--destination_configuration--s3_configuration))

<a id="nestedatt--destination_configuration--s3_configuration"></a>
### Nested Schema for `destination_configuration.s3_configuration`

Optional:

- `role_arn` (String)

- `value` (String)

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

In Terraform v1.12.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `identity` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = awscc_logs_scheduled_query.example
  identity = {
    scheduled_query_arn = "scheduled_query_arn"
  }
}
```

### Identity Schema

#### Required

- `scheduled_query_arn` (String)

#### Optional

- `account_id` (String) AWS Account where this resource is managed
- `region` (String) Region where this resource is managed

In Terraform v1.5.0 and later, the [`import` block](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/language/import) can be used with the `id` attribute, for example:

```terraform
import {
  to = awscc_logs_scheduled_query.example
  id = "scheduled_query_arn"
}
```

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
$ terraform import awscc_logs_scheduled_query.example "scheduled_query_arn"
```
